{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Buffalo |model=WZR-HP-G302H |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date= |manuf_country=China |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id= |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atheros |cpu1_model=AR7242 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=AR9283 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none=true |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Atheros |sw_model=AR8316 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=XXXXXXXXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^[A-F0-9]{16}$ |default_ip=192.168.11.1 |default_user=root |default_pass= |oui=4C:E6:76 |oui_eth=4C:E6:76 }} [http://wiki.openwrt.org/toh/buffalo/wzr-hp-g300nh2 WZR-HP-G300NH2 on the OpenWrt wiki] (w/ boot log for the G302H) :The WZR-HP-G302H appears to be a Japanese variant of the G300NH2 ::"WZR-HP-G302HV2" and "21514W302HV21A2 Rev:A2" is silkscreened on the board. ::AR9283-AL1A Wi-Fi chip [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=36901 On the OpenWrt forums] :appears to be shipping with U-Boot 1.08, serial console disabled
The default IP is 192.168.11.1 w/ router mode on '''or''' 192.168.11.100 w/ router mode off. The default SSID appears to be the MAC address (upper case hex letters, no delimiters between octets).
